awd_abstract_narration: This investigation will address the regional energetics of              the Gulf Stream system by deploying a set of acoustic doppler                   current profilers (ADCP) pointing upward from a current meter                   mooring.  The velocity data from the ADCP's will be used to                     investigate variations in the structure of the current and                      processes governing the instabilities of the system.                            Additionally comparisons with satellite imagery will be used to                 determine correlations between surface thermal patterns and the                 underlying velocity.  The project is in conjunction with a major                Gulf Stream project, SYNOP, to obtain information on the dynamics               of the Stream in order to gain modeling capability for its                      evolution.  This project will be closely coordinated with SYNOP,                and in particular with mooring experiments of scientists from the               University of Rhode Island.
